description: 1.5-hour test on describing and identifying minerals and rocks, their uses in products, and environmental impacts. Includes multiple choice and short answer questions.

3-minute science communication video and transcript analyzing a NSW fossil site or Australian Museum fossil collection item, referencing scientific literature. Focuses on geological/evolutionary context.
Poster presentation critiquing controversial geoscience topics from media/literature. Developed through group discussions in Week 9 and presented in Week 10 laboratories.

2-hour comprehensive exam covering all course content (lectures, labs, readings). Tests understanding of Earth processes, evolution, measurement methods, and resource impacts through multiple choice/short answer questions.
